New Records: Freddie Freeman ended Game One with the first ever walk-off grand slam in the World Series.
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam in the tenth inning secured the Dodgers' victory.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a home run in the sixth inning to give the Yankees a temporary lead.
Mookie Betts hit a sacrifice fly in the eighth inning to tie the game.
Anthony Volpe's fielder's choice in the tenth inning scored Jazz Chisholm to give the Yankees a brief lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Gerrit Cole expressed disappointment that his strong performance did not lead to a win.
Aaron Judge's postseason struggles were highlighted as a significant factor in the Yankees' loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers and Yankees each held the best records in their respective leagues this season.
This was the 63rd walk-off win in World Series history and the 63rd Fall Classic game that went to extra-innings.
It was the fifth time ever that the Dodgers won a World Series game in walk-off fashion.
Others: Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Carlos Rodon are scheduled to pitch in Game Two of the World Series.
